item.title: LIKE PAPER
item.description: What seems to be folded paper, is made out of slewed concrete. The property of concrete, to precisely display the surface of the utilized formwork, is taken to advantage. We analyzed concrete and researched new production methods for this material. Our goal was to develop novel ways that would give the otherwise raw synthetic stone a fresh face. The project like paper is very much based on the experiments of combining concrete and rotational molding.
item.content:encoded: What seems to be folded paper, is made out of slewed concrete. The property of concrete, to precisely display the surface of the utilized formwork, is taken to advantage. We analyzed concrete and researched new production methods for this material. Our goal was to develop novel ways that would give the otherwise raw synthetic stone a fresh face. The project like paper is very much based on the experiments of combining concrete and rotational molding.

item.title: Link 10: Decode or Die
item.description: DensityDesign collaborated with Link on its tenth issue, titled Decode or die. Linfografica applicata alla tv (Decode or die. Infographics applied to television). The collaboration has been a great chance for DensityDesign to experiment much more than usual with some visualization technique while developing a series of scripts for streamlining the creation of the visualizations. In fact the collaboration started with a very open minded approach and Link granted us an incredible amount of freedom on the visualizations, which is such a rare feature in the publishing world.
item.content:encoded: DensityDesign collaborated with Link on its tenth issue, titled Decode or die. Linfografica applicata alla tv (Decode or die. Infographics applied to television). The collaboration has been a great chance for DensityDesign to experiment much more than usual with some visualization technique while developing a series of scripts for streamlining the creation of the visualizations. In fact the collaboration started with a very open minded approach and Link granted us an incredible amount of freedom on the visualizations, which is such a rare feature in the publishing world.

item.title: Object Oriented Installation Documentation
item.description: The series Object Oriented is a specially commissioned work created by Gabriel Shalom for MINI for the IAA 2011. The hidden music of objects is made perceptible by means of an alchemical transformation which occurs in videomusical time. The resulting rhythms and harmonies allow us to experience our surroundings with a newly heightened appreciation for the audiovisual dynamics of the world around us. Curated by Meiré und Meiré.
item.content:encoded: The series Object Oriented is a specially commissioned work created by Gabriel Shalom for MINI for the IAA 2011. The hidden music of objects is made perceptible by means of an alchemical transformation which occurs in videomusical time. The resulting rhythms and harmonies allow us to experience our surroundings with a newly heightened appreciation for the audiovisual dynamics of the world around us. Curated by Meiré und Meiré.

item.title: Sample Sample
item.description: Material sample interpretations as simulations of macroscopically photographed nano-sculptures. The base for these enlarged tiny grown crystal structures are textile pattern, with two different levels of translation. One is the layer of color, where a scan of the textile is taken directly to color individual parts of the structure. The second layer is a translation of fabric weavings into three dimensional stacks of interlocked platonic bodies. Both layers are in an uneasy, off-set relation with each other. On a meta level, the simulation of photographed space seduces to imagine this setup as an existing material reality.
item.content:encoded: Material sample interpretations as simulations of macroscopically photographed nano-sculptures. The base for these enlarged tiny grown crystal structures are textile pattern, with two different levels of translation. One is the layer of color, where a scan of the textile is taken directly to color individual parts of the structure. The second layer is a translation of fabric weavings into three dimensional stacks of interlocked platonic bodies. Both layers are in an uneasy, off-set relation with each other. On a meta level, the simulation of photographed space seduces to imagine this setup as an existing material reality.

item.title: Jou Jou Toy Store - The Monsters Wall
item.description: our friends from StrucAxiom invited us to be part of one of the most interesting and challenged project we have been involved: The launch of a Toy Store calles Jou Jou inside The Grand American Hotel in Salt Lake City. Our task was the Art and Animation Direction of a wall Plenty of Monsters, that had to entertain, to frighten and to amuse to all the kids that enter the Store! It was a very ambitious and super funny project in which there were 10 monsters in different LED Screens hanged in a wall. The Monsters interact once a movement has been detected. With StrucAxiom initial concepts and an lot of had work we created 8 out of the 10 monsters, that it has stolen a lot of smiles! With only see the kids reactions in front the Monster Wall, We feel more Plenty than never!
item.content:encoded: our friends from StrucAxiom invited us to be part of one of the most interesting and challenged project we have been involved: The launch of a Toy Store calles Jou Jou inside The Grand American Hotel in Salt Lake City. Our task was the Art and Animation Direction of a wall Plenty of Monsters, that had to entertain, to frighten and to amuse to all the kids that enter the Store! It was a very ambitious and super funny project in which there were 10 monsters in different LED Screens hanged in a wall. The Monsters interact once a movement has been detected. With StrucAxiom initial concepts and an lot of had work we created 8 out of the 10 monsters, that it has stolen a lot of smiles! With only see the kids reactions in front the Monster Wall, We feel more Plenty than never!

item.title: Popular Mechanics 110th Edition
item.description: I was asked by Popular Mechanics to do a type based design for the cover of their 110th Anniversary Edition. After an initial round of ideas we settled on a style that was a modern spin on the decorative printing styles from the era the magazine was conceived in. This is the final design I sent them, but the final colours were tweaked by the client before going to print to maxamise shelf impact. I will update the project with a photo of the printed cover once I get a copy
item.content:encoded: I was asked by Popular Mechanics to do a type based design for the cover of their 110th Anniversary Edition. After an initial round of ideas we settled on a style that was a modern spin on the decorative printing styles from the era the magazine was conceived in. This is the final design I sent them, but the final colours were tweaked by the client before going to print to maxamise shelf impact. I will update the project with a photo of the printed cover once I get a copy

item.title: Nike "Catch the Flash" (Promotion)
item.description: In Fall 2011 Nike launched the Vapor Flash Jacket in Germany, Austria and Switzerland. A running jacket that is unique, because it fully reflects. Every runner wearing it is safer, since the Nike Vapor Flash Jacket makes him visible in the dark. Our idea: Catch the Flash the first chase that makes the invisible visible. On the dark streets of Vienna and at the same time online. Starting: 50 Nike Runners wearing Vapor Flash Jackets. The Flashrunners. The whole of Vienna was chasing them in the streets. Because those flashing most of the Flashrunners with their cameras and thereby revealing their jacket numbers won a 10,000 euro platinum bar. Simultaneously, the rest of the world took part on our microsite. Since all 50 Flashrunners transferred their GPS data to the Catch the Flash Online Game in real time by using an app.
item.content:encoded: In Fall 2011 Nike launched the Vapor Flash Jacket in Germany, Austria and Switzerland. A running jacket that is unique, because it fully reflects. Every runner wearing it is safer, since the Nike Vapor Flash Jacket makes him visible in the dark. Our idea: Catch the Flash the first chase that makes the invisible visible. On the dark streets of Vienna and at the same time online. Starting: 50 Nike Runners wearing Vapor Flash Jackets. The Flashrunners. The whole of Vienna was chasing them in the streets. Because those flashing most of the Flashrunners with their cameras and thereby revealing their jacket numbers won a 10,000 euro platinum bar. Simultaneously, the rest of the world took part on our microsite. Since all 50 Flashrunners transferred their GPS data to the Catch the Flash Online Game in real time by using an app.
